title: 108_s2754
content: The "Social Security COLA Protection Act of 2004" aims to safeguard Social Security cost-of-living increases from excessive Medicare premium hikes. The "Social Security COLA Protection Act of 2004" amends Section 1839(f) of the Social Security Act to adjust Part B premiums for individuals entitled to certain benefits starting from 2005. The "Social Security COLA Protection Act of 2004" adjusts Part D premiums to limit increases based on Social Security COLA adjustments. The "Social Security COLA Protection Act of 2004" adjusts Part D premiums to limit increases based on Social Security COLA adjustments for individuals entitled to monthly benefits under specific sections. The "Social Security COLA Protection Act of 2004" limits Part D premium increases based on Social Security COLA adjustments for individuals receiving benefits. The Special rule for partial premium subsidy individuals limits Part D premium increases for those enrolled in the program. If the individual is also enrolled in Part B, there is a specific factor for calculating the annual premium increase. The annual increase in premium under section 1839(a)(3) is limited for individuals enrolled in the Medicare savings program. This does not apply to those enrolled in the Medicare Advantage program. The Medicare Advantage program premium is amended to include section 1860D-13(a)(1)(F) for prescription drug beneficiaries. Payment from the Medicare prescription drug account is adjusted under section 1860D-16(b) with a new subparagraph for premium payment. The Medicare Advantage program premium is amended to include payment for cola protection premium reductions under section 1860D-13(a)(1)(F) for prescription drug beneficiaries. The Secretary will provide payment to PDP sponsors or MA organizations equivalent to the premium reduction amount for eligible individuals enrolled in their plans. The Medicare Advantage program premium is amended to include payment for cola protection premium reductions under section 1860D-13(a)(1)(F) for prescription drug beneficiaries. Payment will be provided to PDP sponsors or MA organizations equivalent to the premium reduction amount for eligible individuals enrolled in their plans. The provisions of subsections (d) and (f) of section 1860D-15 apply to this payment in the same manner as they apply to payments under such section. The disregard of premium reductions in determining dedicated revenues under the MMA Cost Containment is also addressed in the amendments. Effective Dates: The amendments made by subsection (a) apply to Part B premiums starting from January 2005, while the amendments made by subsection (b) apply to Part D premiums starting from January 2007. The amendment made by subsection (c) will take effect on the date of the enactment of this Act.
